page.title: 13FARMING : Oilseed rape
page.content: One of the major changes in the farming landscape of this area over the last two years has been the introduction of{OILSEED RAPE}as a major new cash crop. The plant has a long growing season of 12 months. It is planted in August and harvested the following July/August. Many fields of bright yellow flowers in late Spring have an obvious impact on the eye. The oil is used as a vegetable cooking oil but has to be mixed with other oils before it is usable. The waste matter has certain limited value as cattle feed. The crop yield can be increased by almost 15% if beekeepers locate their hives in the field. The plant is a valuable source of pollen and nectar although the granulation qualities of the honey are not totally desirable to all apiarists.
